competitors.aiSummary: Aave reaches $575M deposits on Mantle, sets DeFi standards with Aave Horizon and Earn, offering stablecoin yield and ERC-4626 vaults.

tweets.fullText: @StaniKulechov üëª

Aave crossed $575 million deposits on @Mantle_Official. 

Higher. https://t.co/Aht6CosPSH
@0xKolten üëª

As more tokenized assets come onchain, Aave is setting the standard for how they should work in DeFi.

Read how Aave Horizon is built to support institutions: https://t.co/AkRPR2v4eL

Aave Horizon Earn is an example of what can be built to offer users stablecoin yield from KYC'd institutional borrowers.

It provides an API and ERC-4626 vaults that wallets, exchanges, custodians, and treasury platforms can embed as a simple deposit-and-earn product.

competitors.aiSummary: JupUSD offers 3.5% borrow rate, outperforming USDC, USDG, and USDT. Lend features pegged vaults, JUICED, and max 89% LTV.

tweets.fullText: @cFLowx_ It depends on the vault! https://t.co/Qh8QTlbQWN
Here's a quick guide on how to borrow jupUSD against your SOLüëá https://t.co/vxUvAm49L9

JupUSD has the lowest borrow rate of any stablecoin for JLP and SOL, at just 3.5%.

Compare that to other stables:
‚Ä¢ USDC: 4% 
‚Ä¢ USDG: 4.3%
‚Ä¢ USDT: 4.5%

That difference is extra money staying in your position. https://t.co/KQguBS574R

For a deeper explanation of pegged vaults:

https://t.co/jUDMKoDP8N

You can borrow against your yield-bearing JUICED with a max LTV of 89%

Or Multiply it for up to 11.64% APY.

And since it's a pegged vault, the 2 assets are tightly correlated, reducing liquidation risk.

In fact there haven't been any pegged vault liquidations on Lend to date. https://t.co/gS6SIv3D9s

competitors.aiSummary: Yearn V3 supports Term's fixed-rate lending, with flexible infrastructure and tokenized strategies, automating auctions and rebalancing.

tweets.fullText:
The revenues are flowing!

Stake your YFI, veYFI, liquid locker YFI to get a piece.

Read all about it in this post by @leche_whisperer
https://t.co/3o0Kx4g3pa

Term didn't need to build vault infrastructure. They focused entirely on their fixed-rate lending logic and plugged it into Yearn V3. The TokenizedStrategy handles the rest.

Yearn V3 infrastructure is flexible enough to support Curve's scrvUSD (zero strategies, pure

Term's vaults automate all of that on top of Yearn's framework. The vaults participate in auctions, reinvest proceeds from maturing loans, and rebalance idle funds into floating-rate lending protocols.

Risk curators propose portfolio constraints and smart contracts enforce them

This is exactly what @term_labs did. Term runs sealed-bid double auctions for fixed-rate lending where lenders and borrowers submit hashed bids. The protocol finds a single clearing rate.

But participating in these auctions, rolling maturing positions, and managing idle capital

Attention: On 9/20/24 the Compound community‚Äôs Discord server was compromised.

Access has been regained and secured.

Always stay vigilant for scams and do not click any suspicious links.

As we noted, the issue did not impact the protocol; and no smart contracts were compromised.

We will provide further details on the investigation soon.

This is our final message // end of tweet.
